questions.question_text:
A router has been configured to provide the nine users on the branch office LAN with Internet access, as shown in the diagram. It is found that some of the users on the LAN cannot reach the Internet. Based on the topology and router output shown, which command should be issued on the router to correct the problem?
//IMG//

comments.content:
There are nine hosts ==>> need more IP addresses for the LAN. 

The current subnet mask is /30, which means ONLY 2 IP addresses available. 

The answer's subnet mask is /28 ==>> It provides 14 IP addresses.

discussion.content:
Question not clear if the line interface and protocol of fa0/0 is up/up which means its working 
and address have been configured as shown on brunch router , why again add another adress ?

questions.question_text: Identify the four valid IPv6 addresses. (Choose four.)

discussion.content: Having ABEF at the end makes it seem as if option F has that as part of the IPV6 address
The correct answer is A, B, E, F
determining the path cost is the answer, STP calculate cost at the first place.

Answer is B

Spanning Tree Protocol (STP) convergence (Layer 2 convergence) happens when bridges and switches have transitioned to either the forwarding or blocking state. When layer 2 is converged, Root Switch is elected and Root Ports, Designated Ports and Non-Designated ports in all switches are selected. At Converged condition, the Root Ports and the Designated ports are in forwarding state, and all other ports are in blocking state.

I believe that the answer is A, given that the cost is determined first before a designated port can be elected. Of course, the port with the lowest cost and interface/switch ID, that would be the designated one.

http://www.omnisecu.com/cisco-certified-network-associate-ccna/how-spanning-tree-protocol-stp-select-designated-port.php
After convergence the designated and root port are elected B
The correct answer is B. electing designated ports

questions.question_text: Which process is associated with spanning-tree convergence?

discussion.content: The answer is displayed on option D, and It's the right answer.
Correct answer is " Transport input all "

questions.question_text: Which command is necessary to permit SSH or Telnet access to a Cisco switch that is otherwise configured for these vty line protocols?

discussion.content:
The line is added on the ACL and it will go at the end of it. 
The HTTP traffic is already permited (permit ip any any), so the new line won't have any effect on the config.

questions.question_text:
Refer to the exhibit. A network technician enters the following line into the router.
Tidmore1(config)# access-list 106 deny tcp 192.168.254.0 0.0.0.255 any eq www
What is the effect of this configuration?
//IMG//

choices.A: The change has no effect on the packets being filtered.
choices.D: No hosts in the 192.168.254.0 LAN except 192.168.254.7 can access web pages from the Internet.
choices.C: Web pages from the Internet cannot be accessed by hosts in the 192.168.254.0 LAN.
choices.B: All traffic from the 192.168.254.0 LAN to the Internet is permitted.
